Necromancers

Masters of Death Magic

Death Magic Rare Dark Ancient

Overview

Necromancers are practitioners of death magic, one of the most feared and powerful schools of magic in the Skulduggery Pleasant universe. They specialize in manipulating death energy, communicating with the dead, and wielding the forces of decay and entropy. Their magic is both ancient and terrible, often requiring great personal sacrifice.

Unlike other magical disciplines that focus on creation or transformation, necromancy deals directly with death, the afterlife, and the boundary between life and death. This makes necromancers both powerful and dangerous, as their magic often comes with significant costs and moral implications.

Characteristics

  • Mastery over death magic and entropy
  • Ability to communicate with spirits and the dead
  • Often physically marked by their magic usage
  • Possess knowledge of ancient death rituals
  • Can manipulate life force and soul energy
  • Frequently misunderstood and feared by others

The Price of Death Magic

Necromancy is known for its terrible costs. The more powerful the death magic used, the greater the toll on the practitioner:

  • Physical Degradation: Necromantic magic slowly destroys the body
  • Mental Strain: Constant exposure to death energy affects the mind
  • Soul Damage: Powerful spells can damage or fragment the soul
  • Social Isolation: Fear and mistrust from other magical beings
  • Shortened Lifespan: Death magic literally consumes life force

Magical Abilities

Necromancers possess a range of death-related magical abilities:

  • Death Sight: Seeing souls, spirits, and death energy
  • Soul Manipulation: Moving, binding, or destroying souls
  • Necromantic Healing: Healing through death magic principles
  • Spirit Communication: Speaking with the dead
  • Death Bolts: Projectiles of concentrated death energy
  • Life Force Drain: Stealing life energy from others
  • Resurrection: Bringing back the dead (extremely dangerous)

Quick Facts

Population: Very Rare
Lifespan: Shortened (50-150 years)
Magic Type: Death Magic
Organization: Solitary/Small Groups
Threat Level: Very High

Notable Necromancers

Related Concepts

Death Bringer Lord Vile Darquesse Soul Magic

Types of Necromantic Magic

Death Sight

The ability to see souls, spirits, and the flow of life and death energy. This is often the first ability necromancers develop.

Soul Manipulation

Advanced necromancers can directly manipulate souls - moving them, binding them, or even destroying them entirely.

Death Bolts

Projectiles of concentrated death energy that can cause instant death or severe necromantic damage to living beings.

Spirit Communication

The ability to speak with the dead, gaining information from spirits or commanding ghostly entities.

Life Force Drain

Stealing life energy from living beings to power necromantic spells or extend the necromancer's own life.

Resurrection

The most dangerous necromantic art - bringing the dead back to life. This almost always comes with terrible consequences.

The Death Bringer

Prophecy and Purpose

The Death Bringer is a prophesied necromancer of immense power who is destined to bring about the end of the world. This figure appears in ancient prophecies and is both feared and sought after by various magical factions.

Characteristics of the Death Bringer:

  • Unparalleled necromantic power
  • Ability to kill with a touch
  • Command over vast armies of the dead
  • Potential to end all life on Earth
  • Often driven to madness by their power

Warning

The Death Bringer represents the ultimate expression of necromantic power and the greatest threat to all life. Various magical organizations work tirelessly to prevent the rise of a true Death Bringer.

Necromantic Training

Stages of Development

Stage 1: Death Sensitivity

Beginning necromancers develop sensitivity to death energy and learn to see the boundary between life and death.

Stage 2: Spirit Communication

Students learn to communicate with spirits and understand the nature of souls and the afterlife.

Stage 3: Death Magic Basics

Learning to channel death energy for basic spells and effects, usually with significant physical cost.

Stage 4: Advanced Techniques

Mastering powerful necromantic abilities while managing the increasing physical and mental toll.

Stage 5: Master Level

True mastery of necromancy, often achieved at great personal cost. Few reach this level and remain sane.

Training Dangers

  • Physical deterioration from magic use
  • Mental instability and madness
  • Soul damage from powerful spells
  • Social isolation and fear from others
  • Risk of becoming consumed by death magic

Relationships with Other Magical Beings

Sorcerers

Status: Fear and Suspicion

Most sorcerers fear and distrust necromancers due to the dangerous nature of death magic. Many magical institutions ban or heavily restrict necromantic practices.

Elementals

Status: Philosophical Opposition

Elementals, who work with life-giving forces, often see necromancers as fundamentally opposed to their nature and purpose.

Vampires

Status: Complex

Vampires, being undead themselves, have a complicated relationship with necromancers. Some fear them, while others seek to learn from them.

Mortals

Status: Unknown Terror

Mortals are generally unaware of necromancers' existence, but when encountered, they instinctively fear the aura of death that surrounds them.

Notable Necromancers in History

Lord Vile

One of the most feared necromancers in history, Lord Vile was known for his incredible power and ruthless nature. His true identity remained hidden for centuries.

Valkyrie Cain

The prophesied Death Bringer, Valkyrie struggled with her necromantic powers while trying to maintain her humanity and relationships.

Melancholia St Clair

A failed Death Bringer candidate who demonstrated the dangers of necromantic power when not properly controlled or guided.
